alert.note: Alert for Pottawattamie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 5:17AM CDT until August 02 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha/Valley has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Pottawattamie County in southwestern Iowa... * Until 745 AM CDT. * At 517 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding may ongoing in rural areas. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Avoca, Walnut, Shelby, Hancock and Botna Bend Park. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 31 and 40. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
